document.ModsDocTitle: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)
document.docAuthor: Van Dam, Matthew H., Laufa, Raymond & Riedel, Alexander
document.docTitle: Trigonopterus silaliensis Van Dam & Riedel, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of Trigonopterus Fauvel from the island of New Britain (Coleoptera, Curculionidae)

caption.paragraph: Figure 4. Trigonopterus silaliensis Van Dam & Riedel, sp. n., holotype; a Dorsal habitus b Lateral habitus c female genitalia.

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype (ANIC): ARC4214 (GenBank # KU888894), PAPUA NEW GUINEA, West New Britain Prov.: E of Silali Village, Nakanai Range, S05°31.233' , E151°03.343' , 800 m, from foliage, 21-22-XI-2014.
This epithet is a Latin adjective based on the name of the village near to which the holotype was collected.

This species belongs to the Trigonopterus honestus -group of Riedel et al. (2013b) and superficially resembles Trigonopterus paucisquamosus (Heller) from the Philippines, which differs by the position of scale patches and a denser punctation.
